"We Believe in Dinosaurs" opens in San Francisco

By Matt Young
March 21, 2019 13:27 MST


The film, We Believe in Dinosaurs, on which we reported a bit over 2 years ago, will open at the San Francisco Film Festival in April. The film, directed by Clayton Brown and Monica Long Ross, features PT contributors Dan Phelps and David MacMillan. It was financed in part by an Indigogo campaign that raised over $60,000 from approximately 400 contributors.

The film follows the construction of the Noah’s Ark “replica” in Kentucky over a 3-year period. You may read more about it in our earlier post.
